prompt: Update the version in package.json from '1.0.0' to '1.1.0'
response:
I'll help you update the version in package.json from '1.0.0' to '1.1.0'.

First, I need to read the current package.json file to see its contents and locate the version field. Then I'll use the edit function to replace the old version with the new one.

Let me start by reading the package.json file:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="read_file">
<parameter name="path">package.json</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_result>
{
  "name": "my-project",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "A sample project",
  "main": "index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "start": "node index.js",
    "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1"
  },
  "keywords": [],
  "author": "",
  "license": "ISC"
}
</function_result>

Perfect! I can see the package.json file contains `"version": "1.0.0"` on line 3. Now I'll use the edit_file tool to replace '1.0.0' with '1.1.0':

<function_calls>
<invoke name="edit_file">
<parameter name="path">package.json</parameter>
<parameter name="old_text">  "version": "1.0.0",</parameter>
<parameter name="new_text">  "version": "1.1.0",</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_result>
File edited successfully.
</function_result>

Great! I've successfully updated the version in package.json from '1.0.0' to '1.1.0'. The edit_file tool was the appropriate choice here because:

1. I needed to make a specific, targeted change to an existing file
2. I wanted to preserve all other content in the file exactly as it was
3. I only needed to replace the version number while maintaining the exact formatting and structure

The version has been updated and the file now contains version "1.1.0" instead of "1.0.0".
